intro: Holosteum sibthorpii, commonly known as the mountain holosteum, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Holosteum sibthorpii thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh, arid environments.
